entries.question: Who is Jashwanth SA?
entries.answer: Jashwanth SA is a Computer Science undergraduate and full-stack developer who enjoys building scalable web apps and data-driven systems.
entries.details: Based in India, he blends backend engineering, cloud, and ML to solve real-world problems.

entries.question: Where is he based?
entries.answer: He is based in India.
entries.details: He is currently studying and building projects in the region.

entries.question: Hello / Hi / Good morning
entries.keywords: hi hello hey good morning good afternoon good evening greetings
entries.answer: Hi there! ðŸ‘‹ How can I help you learn about me today?
entries.details: You can ask about his projects, skills, experience, or education.

entries.question: What is his education?
entries.answer: He is pursuing B.E Computer Science & Engineering at Chennai Institute of Technology (2022-2026) with a CGPA of 8.43.
entries.details: He also completed XII (CBSE) at DAV Boys Sr. Sec. School with 91.4%.

entries.question: Where does he study?
entries.answer: He studies at Chennai Institute of Technology in the CSE program.
entries.details: Expected graduation year is 2026.

entries.question: What coursework has he completed?
entries.answer: Core coursework includes Operating Systems, DBMS, Data Structures and Algorithms, OOPS, and Computer Networks.
entries.details: These fundamentals support his full-stack and ML work.

entries.question: What was his 12th grade result?
entries.answer: He completed XII (CBSE) at DAV Boys Sr. Sec. School with 91.4%.
entries.details: Subjects included Math, Physics, Chemistry, English, and Biology.

entries.question: What experience does he have?
entries.answer: He has interned as an SDE at HID Global and as a Full Stack Developer at Arwin Networks, plus open-source contributions via SSOC.
entries.details: Work includes building features, integrating Stripe, and performance optimization.

entries.question: What is his current internship?
entries.answer: He is currently an SDE Intern at HID Global (Jan 2025 - Present).
entries.details: Working on engineering tasks in a production environment.

entries.question: What did he do at Arwin Networks?
entries.answer: He worked on stuwoork.com, helping users browse and hire freelancers with a smoother UI flow.
entries.details: He also integrated Stripe subscriptions and optimized CSS with Tailwind.

entries.question: What was the impact of the Arwin Networks work?
entries.answer: He improved rendering performance by about 30% and reduced CSS size by 25% using Tailwind.
entries.details: Stripe subscriptions were integrated for recurring payments.

entries.question: What is SSOC Season 3?
entries.answer: SSOC Season 3 is an open-source program where he contributed to projects and participated in creator quests on Quira.
entries.details: It strengthened his collaboration and OSS workflows.

entries.question: What projects has he built?
entries.answer: Key projects include a real-time collaboration app with OPAL, sentiment analysis for Reddit, a fake news detector, and MediSmart.
entries.details: Focus areas include realtime collaboration, NLP analytics, and healthcare data tooling.

entries.question: Tell me about the OPAL project
entries.answer: It is a real-time collaboration app built with React and OPAL for dynamic policy management.
entries.details: Designed for live collaboration with a focus on policy enforcement.

entries.question: What tech stack does the OPAL project use?
entries.keywords: opal tech stack react docker node
entries.answer: The OPAL collaboration app uses React.js, Docker, and Node.js.
entries.details: It leverages OPAL for dynamic policy enforcement.

entries.question: How many users can the OPAL app support?
entries.answer: It was designed for 100+ concurrent users.
entries.details: The goal was stable collaboration at scale.

entries.question: Tell me about the Reddit sentiment analysis project
entries.answer: It analyzes subreddit data to extract sentiment and engagement insights with an automated dashboard.
entries.details: Built with Python, Flask, NLTK, and Scikit-Learn.

entries.question: What was the accuracy in the Reddit sentiment project?
entries.answer: The model achieved about 93% accuracy across multiple sentiment categories.
entries.details: Prediction time was reduced to around 250ms.

entries.question: Tell me about the fake news detection app
entries.answer: It classifies news articles as real or fake using ML pipelines built on Scikit-Learn.
entries.details: Optimized for faster inference and real-time prediction.

entries.question: How large was the fake news dataset?
entries.answer: The model was trained and evaluated on more than 50,000 news articles.
entries.details: Achieved around 92% classification accuracy.

entries.question: What is MediSmart?
entries.answer: MediSmart is an MCP server for hospital patient data with advanced analytics and ML-powered predictions.
entries.details: It includes SHAP explanations and data visualizations.

entries.question: What does MediSmart predict?
entries.answer: MediSmart includes ML-based predictions to estimate patient readmission risk.
entries.details: It also provides analytics and data quality checks.

entries.question: How many records were used in MediSmart?
entries.answer: The model was trained on 989 patient records with 5 features.
entries.details: It can auto-train if a model artifact is missing.

entries.question: What are his skills?
entries.answer: He works with React, Next.js, Node.js, Django, MySQL, MongoDB, and ML libraries like PyTorch and Scikit-Learn.
entries.details: He is also comfortable with Azure, Docker, and common UI tools.

entries.question: Is he a full-stack developer?
entries.answer: Yes. He works across frontend and backend, with database and cloud experience.
entries.details: He enjoys building end-to-end systems.

entries.question: What frontend technologies does he use?
entries.answer: He uses React, Next.js, Angular, and Tailwind CSS for modern UIs.
entries.details: Comfortable with responsive and component-based design.

entries.question: What backend technologies does he use?
entries.answer: He builds backend services with Node.js, Express, and Django.
entries.details: Focus is on scalable APIs and clean architecture.

entries.question: What databases does he work with?
entries.answer: He has experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Neo4j.
entries.details: Also familiar with Firebase.

entries.question: What ML or AI tools does he use?
entries.answer: He uses PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Scikit-Learn for ML work.
entries.details: He also explores Gen-AI tools like LangGraph and Semantic Kernel.

entries.question: What cloud platform does he use?
entries.answer: Azure is his primary cloud platform.
entries.details: He has completed the AZ-900 course.

entries.question: What developer tools does he use?
entries.answer: He uses Git, Docker, Postman, and related dev tools in daily workflows.
entries.details: Also deploys and experiments with Netlify.

entries.question: What certifications or courses has he completed?
entries.answer: Courses include AZ-900, CCNA 1/2/3, Intro to LLM, Business Analyst (Celonis), and Google ML crash course.
entries.details: He also completed a full web development bootcamp on Udemy.

entries.question: Has he studied networking?
entries.answer: Yes, he completed CCNA 1, 2, and 3 through Cisco.
entries.details: Networking fundamentals support his backend work.

entries.question: Has he studied cloud fundamentals?
entries.answer: Yes, he completed Microsoft AZ-900 for cloud fundamentals.
entries.details: He uses Azure in projects and learning.

entries.question: What are his coding platform achievements?
entries.answer: LeetCode: Knight badge (max 1886, top 5.76%). CodeChef: 3-star, 1726. Codeforces: max 1020.
entries.details: He enjoys competitive programming alongside project work.

entries.question: What hackathons has he reached finals in?
entries.answer: He was selected for finals at Technica 2024 and GDSC Hack for SDG.
entries.details: Also selected for Round 2 at the Amdocs GenAI Graduate Hackathon.

entries.question: Any leadership or extracurriculars?
entries.answer: He holds an NCC Cadet Certification and has participated in tech events and hackathons.
entries.details: He also volunteered to organize a Hacker Symposium event.

entries.question: Has he volunteered anywhere?
entries.answer: Yes, he organized a Hacker Symposium event, coordinating participants and activities.
entries.details: Demonstrated leadership and event management.

entries.answer: You can reach him at jash.chn@gmail.com or via LinkedIn and GitHub.
entries.details: Links are available in the sidebar.

entries.answer: You can find him on GitHub at github.com/JashwanthSA.
